commit_list.message: Add color tracking
Add web view for extension basis
Hide conflict edges in web view + small stuff
Increase retry interval when server is down (should prevent spammy retries)
Show message excerpt in server log when sending (for easier debugging)

Try to improve Mac OS performance for web view

* Only update inner graphs on pan/zoom, not at every animation frame
* Set min/max zoom, it gets slower as we zoom in
* Try to avoid updating midpoints outside of viewport, fail for now
* Add performance links for later (see end of web/main.js)

Add command-line parsing

* Commands are :
  - mode [kappa|degree|simple]
  - add <graph_name>
  - add <graph_description> as <graph_name>
  - list   <-- NOT WORKING
  - debug
  - build of (<graph_name>,<graph_name>)
* Parser uses the Angstrom library, see parser.ml.
* test.ml rearranged a bit to deal with "module hopping"
  (the "mode <mode>" command has to restart the
   interactive loop inside a different module)
* All line input uses linenoise library (we get history file, etc)
* The Node modules expose a
  [tn : (int list * int list) list -> (t*t) list] method.

Add `load` argument to test.ml and a tracking script (track.sh)

* `./test.native s f` will set the shape to `shape`, read file `f` and
terminate.
* `./track.sh s f` will autorun `./test.native load s scripts/f`
whenever `scripts/f` is modified.
Simplify module names
Add load <file> command to interactive mode
Change rename result to command
Forgot parser.ml and _tags for ocamlbuild
Improve number parser
Add save-to-file shortcut (p) and leak less memory
update cyoscape
Add conflict & shortcuts
Refactor ws server
Close #12
Try to fix loop in server
Log server-side errors instead of crashing
More node colors. Fixes [mapping] bug.

Add node highlighting

*On hover, nodes below and above hovered node will highlight, together
with edges and conflict edges.
* The 'c' button only toggles conflict edges connected to a highlighted
node.
* Clicking a node maintains the highlight. Click anywhere else to remove
it.
webviz: show node label, not id
Fix indent
Don't render graphs outside viewport.
Experimenting with a new interface

Pseudo thread-safety for EventManager

Memory leaks are certain and races are possible if one object uses
events in both threads.

commit_list.message:
Store simulation NPCs in a map<uuid,NPC*> instead of a set<NPC*>

- It's better to compare uuids directly than to follow pointers to main
memory before every comparison.
- I'm going to make WithUuid a virtual base class, and this prevents
fast (static) cast from WithUuid to NPC. I don't want to have a slow
(dynamic) cast every time someone looks up an NPC so the change from set
to map had to be done anyway.

commit_list.message:
Separate rvalues and lvalues using SFINAE (conditional template instanciation) rather than static if-then-else.

For future reference, the issue was this. Suppose you write in a
function f(T&& t):

  if (is_rvalue<T&&>) { copy t } else { store a reference to t }

And you pass to f an lvalue reference to an object of type T where T has
a deleted copy constructor.

The compiler won't know that, since the if(is_rvalue<T&&>) will fail, t
won't be copied. So it will complain that T has a deleted copy
constructor.

The new method separates "copy t" and "store a reference to t" into 2
overloads of a function. Then the compiler will only consider valid
overloads, and we make them mutually exclusive.
commit_list.repo_description: Repo principal

commit_list.message:
(authors: polimegalo+pangel) Fix memory leak with inventories and potential mleak with Simulation::players.

- Player::inventory is now of type list<unique_ptr<Stuff>>. It would be
list<Stuff> but its elements are polymorphic (downcasted to e.g. Bomb).
- Simulation::players is now of type list<Player> and associated methods
prevent Player duplication.

In both cases, doing Stuff& s = getStuff(); and re-using s later may
segfault if the object referenced by s was deleted.
commit_list.repo_description: Repo principal

commit_list.message:
Fix memory leak in batiment.cc: turned pointer into a local member

There was no destructor for the Batiment class. Also, Batiment and Tile
shared a pointer to the same Coordinate object when a Tile was build
using a Batiment.

I didn't find any use for this sharing of data (for instance changing
the coordinates of a Batiment and see the change in Tile) so I turned
the pointers into local members.

Note that Batiment and Tiles now begin with a Coordinate(0,0) object
instead of an uninitialized pointer as their `picture` member.
commit_list.repo_description: Repo principal

commit_list.message: Silence bad valgrind error by defining the seed of WithUuid.

commit_list.message:
Basic testing framework. Example: ./game test pathfinding

Running ./game test <name> will run a test.

Location
Tests are in test/ and under the test:: namespace.

Current tests
Available tests are: sfml, net, pathfinding, and interface_init

How to add a test called <name>:
1) Create the files test/test_<name>.{h,cc},
2) In test.h, include test_<name>.h,
3) In test.cc, add 'else if (which == "<name>")' to
   test::run(string which).
commit_list.repo_description: Repo principal

commit_list.message:
Add log system. How to use: DBG << "My string"; Update to Boost 1.54.

* Update Boost with sudo apt-get install libboost1.54-all-dev
* On Mac: brew install boost or sudo port install boost
  (1.55! Should work)

* LOG(level) is always enabled
* DBG is for debugging. Disable it in a file with #define DEBUG false.
commit_list.repo_description: Repo principal

commit_list.message:
Simpler EventManager API and code

* You don't need to specify "this" as a parameter when you call
  EventListener::subscribe(...)
* You need to specify your own class when you derive EventListener
  e.g. class A : public EventListener<A> {...}
* EventListener is now a template class.

commit_list.message:
Fix segfault

Problem was double deletion of member speed shared by two Batiment
instances. When one writes :

    Batiment batiment; // 1
    batiment = Batiment(); // 2

It creates create two batiments : 1 and 2, and copies batiment2 to
batiment1.

With Batiment { ... Bla* m ...  ~Batiment() { delete m; } ... }, this
assignment results in batiment1.m == batiment2.m.
When batiment2 is (implicitly) deleted, *batiment2.m is deleted.
When batiment1 is (implicitly) deleted, *batiment1.m is deleted... but
it already was. segfault.
commit_list.repo_description: Repo principal

commit_list.message:
Multiple fixes

- Fix tsubst (actually, fix typing): tvars higher than the
substituted one should be decreased.
- Fix type inference to reflect previous typing fix: no shift in the
type of the variable being abstracted.
- Add details to comments about ongoing insert_kind_typing proof.
